intro: Codonoboea leucocodon, commonly known as the white codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
